title: [bug] WixUtilExtension in custom fragments make light.exe invocation fail when bundling Windows app

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

When supplying a custom fragment to add functionality to the Windows MSI installer created by tauri, attempting to use `WixUtilExtension` will make the `light.exe` invocation fail due to a duplicate argument.

### Reproduction

1. Follow the instructions under https://tauri.app/v1/guides/building/windows#extending-the-installer-with-wix-fragments
2. Replace line 2 of the example `wxs` file from `<Wix xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wix/2006/wi">` to `<Wix xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wix/2006/wi" xmlns:util="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wix/UtilExtension">`
3. Run `cargo tauri build --verbose`
4. Observe error message:

```
Command `C:\Users\agersant\AppData\Local\tauri/WixTools\light.exe  -ext C:\Users\agersant\AppData\Local\tauri/WixTools\WixUtilExtension.dll -ext WixUIExtension -ext 
WixUtilExtension -o C:\Users\agersant\Documents\GitHub\tiger\src-tauri\target\release\wix\x64\output.msi -cultures:en-us -loc C:\Users\agersant\Documents\GitHub\tiger\src-tauri\target\release\wix\x64\locale.wxl *.wixobj`
Windows Installer XML Toolset Linker version 3.11.2.4516
Copyright (c) .NET Foundation and contributors. All rights reserved.

light.exe : error LGHT0126 : The extension 'Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Extensions.UtilExtension' contains a defintion for table 'EventManifest' that collides with a previously loaded table definition. 
 Please remove one of the conflicting extensions or rename one of the tables to avoid the collision.
       Error [tauri_cli] failed to bundle project: error running light.exe: error running light.exe: `failed to run C:\Users\agersant\AppData\Local\tauri/WixTools\light.exe`
```

Specifically, the WinUtilExtension got added twice to the list of arguments, as `-ext C:\Users\agersant\AppData\Local\tauri/WixTools\WixUtilExtension.dll` and also as `-ext WixUtilExtension`.

### Expected behavior

Bundling completes with no error

### Platform and versions

```
Environment
  › OS: Windows 10.0.19044 X64
  › Webview2: 109.0.1518.52
  › MSVC: 
      - Visual Studio Build Tools 2019
  › Node.js: 19.0.1
  › npm: 8.19.2
  › pnpm: Not installed!
  › yarn: Not installed!
  › rustup: 1.25.1
  › rustc: 1.66.0
  › cargo: 1.66.0
  › Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc 

Packages
  › @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.2.2 (outdated, latest: 1.2.3)
  › @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.2.0
  › tauri [RUST]: 1.2.3,
  › tauri-build [RUST]: 1.2.1,
  › tao [RUST]: 0.15.8,
  › wry [RUST]: 0.23.4,

App
  › build-type: bundle
  › CSP: default-src 'self'; img-src 'self' asset: https://asset.localhost
  › distDir: ../dist
  › devPath: http://localhost:3000/
  › framework: Vue.js
  › bundler: Vite

App directory structure
  ├─ .git
  ├─ .github
  ├─ .vscode
  ├─ dist
  ├─ docs
  ├─ node_modules
  ├─ res
  ├─ src
  └─ src-tauri
```

### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
